Chapter.Title: Chapter 3–Urban Legend–‘And I savor the magnificent fragrance of the sacrifice, which fills my room.’

Place.PlaceName: Location: Thumb Southern Base - Meeting Room

Dialog.Content: Tell me, who do you think will be the one to get through all this mist and claim the collapsed Nest in the end?
It’s hard for me to predict the outcome of this event, underboss. It has been a while since we were involved in a bloodshed of this scale.
However, it is certain that we should not allow the Index to take over the yolk.
Well said. The Middle, the Ring, and the Pinky seem to be too occupied with their own business to take part in this strife, so that’s a relief.
Have you heard of ‘The Library’, a recently appointed Urban Legend?
Perhaps it will be closely related to this Nest we’re so concerned with.
Go on.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looks like we’re about to ride a real big wave!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What wave?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: At this rate, the Library will soon be exalted to being an Urban Legend from its status as an Urban Myth.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The City is brimming with cheap Urban Myths. It’s really hard to tell which are real and which are all made up.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s more, a lot of those Urban Myths turn out to be pretty plain and boring when you get down to the root of it all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The real fun begins when an Urban Myth gets recognized as an Urban Legend.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re being too roundabout.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If the Associations designate us with a higher grade, we can expect to attract guests of higher classes with more valuable information, is that what you’re trying to say?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You got it! Urban Legends get talked about; people will begin to acknowledge us as an actual phenomenon in the City that’s worth their attention.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You see, when I was a kid, my grandma used to tell me tales about all sorts of Urban Legends. They would always send a chill down my spine.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ah, bugger. Didn’t want to be reminded of the old days.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Family…?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, a family. I lost them all, though.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So you’re without a family now?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No one’s with me anymore. I was raised by my grandma.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Dunno how my parents passed away, n’ grandma disappeared without notice one day.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And then… Nevermind. It’s nothing special.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What were you even trying to say?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyways, you said your goal is to get this one book that’ll give you freedom, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s right. I want the freedom to leave this place, and the freedom to live as myself.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And the freedom to forget…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Then, is freedom the only reason you’re trying to gather all these books?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re only half right.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: During my time living underground, I could only pick up fragmented information about the outside world.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen and heard the same stories over and over and over again.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I want to hear new stories now. I want to see new faces.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s also why I’m looking for the book that contains everything about the world.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And a little bit of revenge at the same time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Revenge, huh. For what?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m taking revenge on the abominable person and world that made me into what I am.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Only after I’ve completely and thoroughly destroyed everything he dreamed for, will my freedom finally be whole.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …So you’ll eventually get to the freedom and vengeance you want if we keep following where this red invitation leads us to?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It will guide me to the book that will let me achieve such things, to be exact.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How exactly those wishes will come true is beyond me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The one book that will complete me and the Library…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If I can find that one absolute book containing everything I want to know, all will be resolved.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wait, hold on. That’s your whole plan? Just find the book? You don’t exactly know how to earn that freedom and stuff?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The only thing I know for sure is that I myself will become whole at the end of the journey led by the invitation.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Library has infinite space. I could extract infinite books from countless guests and store them all if I wanted to.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But simply collecting books that are mostly filled with junk without a clear purpose in mind is rather inefficient, don’t you think?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Hence the invitation’s guidance along the path that leads to the book I wish to obtain, as I explained before.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Let’s say that you got the one book somehow.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But you don’t even know what it’ll exactly do to you to make you “whole”?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t care what happens to me. I’ll be satisfied with anything as long as I can get the results.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s almost scary how tenacious you are.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Zwei Association - Southern Branch, Section 6

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You can’t kneel forever you know.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I beg you. My juniors… They’re all dead.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’ve said that a million times by now. It’s gonna ring in my ears for days.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Look, I know what happened. Your crew all died on a trip to a place called ‘The Library’.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I’d like to request the Zwei for support. I want to retrieve their books at least.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And barging into Zwei HQ to beg like this is not the right way to do it. Come on, you know better than that.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Isadora, please… Let’s help him out just once. Could we at least request our superiors for a review of this case?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Julia. I know you’re friends with this idiot, but even then, we should not act upon friendship or attachment. The whole system could collapse otherwise.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The lobby will be filled with all kinds of miserable folks, begging and pleading for help.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You may be a low-grade pipsqueak, but you’re still Zwei’s Associate Fixer nonetheless. You’d better remember what you learned today.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: But I’m responsible for this case, and…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And the association is responsible for it, too.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Nowhere in our records does it say that Zwei is involved in this case, though? I have no idea what you’re talking about, miss.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: So that’s how it is… You use us as you please, then turn your back on us so easily…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hello, you’re putting the blame on the wrong people here.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Even if such a deal did take place like you said, you must have demanded or at least expected a corresponding reward. That’s what a deal is after all.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You used the association as much as the association used you. You don’t get to talk like it was one-sided extortion.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Come on, let’s not act like rookies now. You’ve been in this business for 8 years, you should know how things work by now.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Isadora! You don’t have to be so harsh. We all started out as Office-mates…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m just frustrated. I don’t want to see him in such a wretched state, either.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Sorry. I understand what you’re trying to say.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: You’re right, that’s how it’s always been… I’ll go look for another way now.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: San… I’m so sorry… I never thought it would turn out this way…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Well would you look at that. Now this is the proper procedure I’m talking about.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The Hana Association just elevated ‘The Library’ from Urban Myth to Urban Legend.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That means…! Our association can now officially act on this case, right?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: W-well, yeah, but we still don’t know Zwei’s stance on it yet, so, don’t get your hopes up, alright?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Thank you, Isadora… I really owe you one.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: And apologies for laying my burden on you.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I-it’s nothing, all I did was compile information following procedure and send it to the higher ups.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: There certainly have been reports that several other Syndicates and Offices fell victim to ‘The Library’, although they were mostly insignificant fledglings.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: But it’s all thanks to the masterful data analysis by our lovely Isadora from Section 6 that it could be handled so quickly, right? That’s my girl!

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Fine, believe in whatever you want!

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Anyway, do you still have that invitation with you?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looks like an Association is about to make their move. Things will be different from now on.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How much of a difference does that make?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The guests we’ve had so far all gave us a visit out of casual interest or curiosity, but our future guests will have a clear goal in mind involving the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How so?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A case officially recognized by the Associations is guaranteed to be rewarding. And money attracts an awful lot of attention.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The scale of our affairs is only going to escalate from here, like it or not.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Our threat level or importance is still probably on the lower end, but we’ll nevertheless get all sorts of people trying to unravel the mysteries of this place as long as the Associations have an eye on us.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I like the sound of that. I can make more valuable books out of them. I still have a lot to see and learn.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve been wondering for a while, but what’s stopping you from leaving here?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I am under a curse.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: A deep, ancient curse; that is what’s attached to me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No being that isn’t human can walk out of this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Besides, I don’t want to leave this place until I’ve had my revenge, either.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s not too bad so far. Rather, I’ve been actually quite delighted lately.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It has been full of brand new things, unlike the prison that was my past life.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: New faces, accumulating knowledge, intriguing events… I like this abundance of freshness. I want to know more. I will keep learning and learning. And as I learn, I might finally figure out…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Why I had to be subject to such torment…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Guess I gotta work harder, then. I can’t leave here as long as you can’t, you know?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey. If we get to leave one day, why don’t I take you to a place I frequent?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You mean a restaurant?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. They make some sick meat stew there.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: One of the secrets to that stew is the giant tin pot they commissioned T Corp. to customize. Boil meat with some water for just ten seconds in that thing, and you get tenderized meat with a rich broth that you’d normally only get after three straight days of boiling.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Creating a taste that’s so rich in such a short time is what makes the restaurant so hot. The only issue is that prices are a bit high. I spent half of my last job’s payout on a single meal one time. But it’s totally worth it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, right, are you incapable of eating…? Sorry for bringing up useless words, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There are plenty of other places you’d love to visit, so I’ll make sure to give you a tour through the City, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can eat, but I cannot taste the food.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I do wish to try dining like you people do if I get a chance, though.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In any case, we need to finish the task at hand before anything.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And the stew… I’ll keep that in mind.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Zwei Association - Southern Branch, Section 6

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We have a lineup of the search team. And you two are in, San, Julia.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I’m finally heading back to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Let’s go retrieve the books of Mars and Lulu, and come back safely.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t forget. While our main objective has been decided as retrieving the books of Mars and Lulu thanks to the coincidence of interests between San and the Association, we should still try to secure as much information as possible. Meaning we should collect as many books as we can.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Okay. I’ll keep that in mind.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I know it’s a silly question to ask, but why is Zwei, an Association specializing in peacekeeping and security, deciding to set up a search team of all things to enter the Library?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Why did you come begging to us in the first place if you knew all that?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: That’s… That’s because this was the only place I could count on.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What about your younger brother?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: My brother is… Never mind. Once again, I’m sorry for the trouble, and thanks again for the help.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: San…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hm hmm. Anyway, since you’re running an affiliate Office, I suppose it’s okay to tell you this.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The Distortion Phenomenon, classified as an Urban Nightmare. I’m sure you’ve at least heard of it even if you haven’t seen it yourself, right?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s an anomaly that has been happening throughout the City ever since the White Nights and Dark Days.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The frequency may be low, but people are turning into monsters at random, and each individual occurrence is a huge pain to deal with.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I know. ‘The Pianist’, the first reported case of this phenomenon… It ended up killing 80% of District 9’s population.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I heard that it was so sudden, the Hana Association had to dispatch one of the ‘Colors’ immediately after realizing the severity of the situation.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s right. Yet we still don’t have any clues to track down the cause of this phenomenon.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The most we have is the sudden disappearance of L Corp, and the ‘White Nights and Dark Days’ whose starting point was in the corporation’s Nest.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Zwei suspects that the Library may be one of the keys to understanding the Distortion Phenomenon.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: A coworker told me a similar story. Said a resident in the area they were peacekeeping was suddenly distorted and transformed into a four-legged beast, even though there weren’t any signs of danger or anomaly nearby.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Thankfully, they managed to take care of that creature before the death toll could hit two digits.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And I also heard that a restaurant clerk turned into a… man-eating sandwich monster? Something like that one time.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I think I understand now. So the Distortion Phenomenon is a clear and apparent threat to Zwei’s peacekeeping activities, and they expect the Library to hold a clue for resolving it.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You got that right. Fortunately, there haven’t been any cases of the phenomenon that’s nearly as devastating as ‘The Pianist’ so far.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: It looks like Zwei is going to keep an eye out for the Library for a while. Though there are several other suspects they need to investigate as well, so we won’t be getting any high-grade Fixers.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: This is more than enough help. Thanks, Isadora.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I-I said I’m just doing my job. It’s not like I’m doing you a favor or anything.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sure you are! You have my thanks as well, Isadora.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Let’s get to it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is that really true?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What is?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The things they said about the Library. Is this place really all connected to stuff like ‘White Nights and Dark Days’, L Corp, and the Distortion Phenomenon?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m frankly not even sure where we are in the City, though.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What if I said it is?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If you said it is… I’m not sure I get what you mean.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s extremely rare for an incident to encompass the City like the White Nights and Dark Days did.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There have been some cases of Wings falling apart on their own, but those only affected their own Nests at most. L Corp. was something else entirely.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s like the whole City fell asleep for a week.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Let’s say that the Library really is related to the White Nights and Dark Days. What does that change?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing, I guess. My work is still gonna be the same…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: So this is the Library. The transportation method is almost like a Singularity.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: …Yeah. The director of the Library will soon come and greet us.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Angela… was it?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Though it appears that you already know who I am.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: We’re here to take back the books of Mars and Lulu.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They are here indeed.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We can get the books we want, or die and turn into books ourselves, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That is correct. As it is written on the invitation.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s like I’m talking to a wall. She’s so robotic.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …The Library is located in the source of the ‘White Nights and Dark Days’.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I touched up the headquarters of L Corp, the center of it, for my own use.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have no comment to make on the Distortion Phenomenon that apparently started occurring afterwards.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have little to no information about that phenomenon, either.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Though I do have a guess.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa, that came outta nowhere…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You were curious about it earlier, weren’t you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was created as a mechanical secretary to assist the manager of Lobotomy Corporation.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was designed to look like a human, feel emotions, and make evaluations and judgements based on those emotions.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s as you suspected; I was born in secret, violating the AI Ethics Amendment.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I never got to make my own judgement, funnily enough. I had to read the same script over and over for one million years, all for the success of a single project.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The play that never seemed to end finally concluded one day, and… And…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the ‘White Nights and Dark Days’ happened as a result. Thanks for letting me know.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t know who came up with that insane plan, but thanks to them, the Distortion Phenomenon started wreaking havoc on the City at random intervals.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ordinary people would turn into monsters all of a sudden. And they’d kill everything in sight.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the first ever case of the Distortion, boy, was that a hellscape.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It happened without any oncoming sign in a District that everyone believed to be relatively safe.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The massacre was a work of art, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It was named ‘The Pianist’ for a reason. What more could I say.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, thanks for telling me all that. Must have been a sensitive topic to you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You aren’t as shocked as I expected.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The monsters created from the Distortion did give off a suspiciously similar vibe to this library and its caretakers.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You must’ve gone through a whole lot of distress in your life.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, what comes next is the problem. What can we do to lure the Zwei here?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …You can use this book. I tried writing down the relationship between L Corp. and the Distortion phenomenon. It should be quite valuable to them under these circumstances.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Zwei Association - Southern Branch, Section 6

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes, sir. I’m afraid San and Julia couldn’t make it back. …Requesting additional support.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Isadora. What do you think the purpose of the Library is?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: From the information we’ve gathered so far, it’s the accumulation of knowledge.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Accumulation of knowledge, you say…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The Library simply offers a deal. It has no influence on the outside world; it only rewards or punishes those who have entered.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The winner can get the books they want, and the loser becomes a book that the Library wants…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Any linkage to the Distortion phenomenon?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That… is unclear, sir.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: But my instincts suggest that it has to be related to the phenomenon somehow.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: And why is that?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The invitation to the Library, its books, and the beings called librarians that reside there. All elements of the Library are similar to what we’ve seen of the Distortion.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: A common feature is that it’s impossible to observe them for an analysis of their constituents or components.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We cannot carry out a comparative analysis because of this, but this inability to observe itself can be considered a common trait.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: It’s not like you to make such baseless claims, is it?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Section 6 will not needlessly obsess over the Library. There is simply too much uncertainty for us to recklessly jump into the case.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: The Zwei Association gets hundreds of requests every day. A fair number of them are allocated to us at Section 6.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you understand that your claims are not compelling enough to make us give up all these requests in favor of the Library.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I am aware, sir.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: And yet here you are, requesting additional manpower for investigating the Library.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Are you sure you aren’t simply using the alleged linkage to the Distortion as an excuse to get your revenge on the Library or retrieve the books of your colleagues?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Even as we speak, Syndicates like ‘The Carnival’ are chewing up people’s guts out in the open, and the likes of ‘The Musicians of Bremen’ are making modern art pieces out of innocent citizens.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: And there are yet more insane individuals looming over the city, no? And our duty is to protect our clients from such shade in the City, is it not?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …You’re right, sir.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Remember the slogan of our association?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: "Your shield", sir.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Exactly. Our role is to be a trusty shield for our client.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: So don’t put down that shield without good reason, got it? You may leave now.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Will do.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Isadora?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Did you happen to put this invitation in my drawer?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: No, sir. I haven’t received any new invitations yet.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: What is the current risk level of the Library…?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s currently resting at the Urban Legend-class, but it has been slowly rising with every new report.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Now I see… The Book of Distortion, is it…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: They’ve been using irresistible bait like this to attract their victims, haven’t they?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Things went rather smoothly thanks to your book. It’s not something we could get from any of the guests we’ve had so far.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I simply offered them what they needed the most at the moment. I am better than anyone at understanding the situation at hand and coming up with an appropriate response.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Precisely, ma’am. You surely did come up with a perfect solution to lure out the Zwei.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, if you can print out books right away, wouldn’t it be nicer to just make a whole lot of ‘em ourselves?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can only write books about the things I know. I need more time to write another one, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, I see… So, can I ask for your publications from time to time, then?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am willing to cooperate, since you’re doing your job as my assistant. Just don’t pester me too much.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sure thing, ma’am~ A mere servant such as I wouldn’t dare commit such atrocity as bothering our mistress Angela, oh no.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you think this will work out well?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The director of a section in an Association like the Zwei should be more than enough as our next step. The information he holds has got to be on a whole ‘nother level from what we’ve collected so far.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: It’s been quite a while since I worked in the field. You haven’t had any field work in a while too, no?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re right, sir.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: If we can get this case resolved, we can finally get out of Section 6.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: It’s nice to be finally collecting information about the Distortion directly from the source instead of having to get my hands dirty engaging with those lowly Syndicates.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: Neither of us should rot in Section 6 for the rest of our lives, wouldn’t you agree?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes…

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: We can have revenge for your colleagues, get a lead on the Distortion Phenomenon, and aim for a higher position all at the same time. How fascinating is that?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Everything seems to fall into place too conveniently.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. I am the d—

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: You must be Angela. Director and librarian of your role’s namesake, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Indeed, it’s just as you said.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen reports about you, but is it true that you are a machine, not a human?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: My my. Staying quiet won’t hide it, girl. A machine must behave as a machine.

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Director
Dialog.Content: You’ve made quite a huge deal out of your little library. It’s rather troublesome to have a non-human like you cause a fuss this big, you know?

Dialog.Title: Zwei S. Section 6 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sir, I don’t think we should provoke her any further…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What does it mean to “behave as a machine”?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, not that topic again…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Someone I used to know loved to say that phrase.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Like I told you before, making machines with emotions or sapience is forbidden. Even if one were to be made, the Head has long settled the ethical implications and all that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That means they’ve decided on a solid answer for the long-standing question: “How is a machine with emotions different from a human?”.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Their answer being: “Even if a machine carries emotions and intelligence, and is nearly identical to a human in every aspect, it is still a machine by birth. Machines should always be below humans…”

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: “…Therefore, it is now forbidden to create sapient machines as they can disrupt the proper judgement of societal values. Furthermore, all existing sapient machines may be subject to termination regardless of ownership.”

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: In short, “Machines are machines, and humans are humans. Machines exist solely to serve humans.” is what they’re saying.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s the mindset people in the City decided to have.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Where would human brains stuffed in heaps of scrap metal belong?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those would still technically count as humans. Some might consider them “defiled”, and others might look down on them, but the brains themselves are natural.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You get what I’m saying?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What about an electronic copy of a human brain?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That… would be a machine. Since it’s not “born” human.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To be frank, I don’t really get these standards, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess birthright matters to them the most.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Maybe it’s a defensive reaction born out of the urge to “preserve” humanity as a species.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …That’s unfair.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing is ever fair in this world.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re right, it seems everyone lives with a share of unfairness they must bear.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Now you’re talking like a City dweller.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Bastards! Like! You!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Need! Some! Beating!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Get! It! Into! Your! Thin! Skull!!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: That’s enough, Gyeong-mi. Beating them to death won’t do us any good.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: District 22 may be our turf, and these chumps you’re beating to a pulp may be from Zwei’s Section 6, but we’re talking about an Association here…

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: We’re gonna be in even bigger trouble if you kill ‘em all.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Walter!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: If! Only! That! Bastard!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Kept! His! Promise! We! Wouldn’t have! Gotten into this mess.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: We! Needed! The! Floorplan! Of! L Corp’s! Nest!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: The Zwei!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Had it!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: We should! Teach!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: These fuckers! A lesson!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: On how important it is to keep promises.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Night will fall soon. Sweepers could come for our asses any second now.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: And the Thumb wouldn’t even contact us.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: We shed blood gathering intel on the Distortion for that bastard Walter, and this is how he repays us?

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Those zealots at the Church of Gears took out more than half our Syndicate.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Their leader was an inhuman freak, alright…

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: We worked our asses off securing the goods from the Church, and for what…

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: If we can’t hand over the floorplan of L Corp’s Nest to the Thumb…

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: All that’s left for us is to get purged by the Thumb for failing our job.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Shouldn’t have made a deal with an Association in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: At least Walter was a sensible one. Maybe something happened to him.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: He might have been a cunning old fart, but he was still the director of Zwei Section 6. Besides, he’d usually leave field jobs to his men. Doesn’t make sense for him to die all too suddenly.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Anything can happen.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: For fuck’s sake, you really killed them all.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: That’s one more option for us.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: You’ve done it again… Flew into a blind rage and crushed their bones and guts to a pulp.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Gyeong-mi! Even if they were a bunch of small fry from Section 6, killing this many of ‘em might get Section 2 or 3 to chase us down.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: The Zwei could send an army of Fixers at us now.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: …These sons of bitches… needed to understand what the weight of a promise is.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: I hope you have a backup plan for when the Zwei come to “thank” us for that lesson.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Just look at this.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: An envelope?

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: The rumored invitation to that library.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Hold on, among the “books of the day” they listed… there’s… The Book of Walter? So that’s what happened? You had a plan after all.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: What… Gyeong-mi!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: So you already knew that Walter died in the Library and still pulverised Section 6?

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: It’s!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: About!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Sending! A damn! Message!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Syndicates have a tendency to kill more than they need to, unlike Fixers. They cause trouble just because they feel like it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, what were they trying to do, getting Sweepers and the Thumb involved?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I might know about the Sweepers.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You do? Well, I guess they are infamous.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I saw them tear humans to pieces and use them as fuel. Are they like that in real life, too?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sort of. One Sweeper is tough as is, but what’s really scary is their organizational power.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They crawl outta the woodwork every night and clean the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We can’t even guess how many of them are there. No matter how many we take down, more would show up the next night.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Think we can make it back in time? Isn’t it a bit tight?

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: It is, but we’ll probably get back just in time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Scratch that!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: Just let us in. We’re in a hurry.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You are rather impatient, I see.

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: I said shut up!

Dialog.Title: Stray Dog
Dialog.Content: And let us in. Now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Isn’t it annoying?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To listen to your silly chirping?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To deal with the things those guests say, I mean.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A lot of ‘em don’t hesitate to spout harsh words at you. I’m surprised you can withstand it all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They’re our precious guests we invited, so it’s only fair to treat them as such.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Besides, I’m already used to keeping others pleased in conversation.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I envy that professionalism of yours.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Maybe you should give a lecture on hospitality to all the restaurant owners in the Backstreets someday. They could really learn a thing or two from you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …But still, it’ll probably be a lot easier on you to be more flexible with greeting guests, rather than sticking to the same polite attitude.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll take note of that.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Big Sis, you’ve seen the message from T Corp, right?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: …Wha? When’d we get that…

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Oh bugger, I’m ‘boutta vom…

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: She threw a huge drinking party with her friends from the same corner of the Backstreets last night.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: They occupied the whole pub and got wasted all night, I heard.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Just how much did you drink this time?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Oi Rain, my head’s still ringing from the hangover, so keep the lecture for later, yeah? Maybe in an hour or so.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: And what’s this? This receipt says…

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: You used our Office funds to pay for it, too…

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: Thank you for utilizing WARP’s services as always.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: The next train departing is WARP train UW-212.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: All passengers please check your pass and make sure you are in the correct carriage for travel. And remember: Watch for it. Warn us. We’ll all be good.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Seems it’s our turn now.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: I always feel ill and out of sorts when I board WARP’s trains.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Just don’t make an arse of yourself like the last time.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Anyway, this request is rather unexpected. One from R Corp. of all places.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Isn’t it something right dangerous if R Corp. has to request another party to do the job?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: They might be just using a no-name Office like us as bait to test the waters ‘fore they do it themselves.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Say, who’s the client for that request?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: The captain of the Rabbit Team herself?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Huhuhu…

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: You kids might be thinking I’m just an easygoing drunkard, but every action of mine is calculated, you see?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Here she goes again.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: That Myo lass is an old mate of mine, I drank with her just yesterday!

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: You mean…

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Said she’s got an easy job for me. Says all I gotta do is give her a small cut of the rewards.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: No wonder you were so proud about going out for a drink.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: I was in a rather good mood, so I let her dine like a king and paid for all that with the Office card~

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Is Myo a trustworthy person?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: She acts like a hotheaded lass, but she’s actually pretty nice deep inside when you get to know her.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: I swear down I’ll curse you for the rest of my life if it turns out to be weird nonsense again.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: All passengers please board WARP train UW-212.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: It’s nice to be on a vacation after so long.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: This is our first time taking a WARP ride. Is everything gonna be okay?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: You’re such a worrywart, darling. So many people use WARP every day.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I heard there were several accidents when they were first starting out.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: You can just stay by my side and keep your eyes closed if you’re so worried silly.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Okay. I’ll stick fast to you and hold tight.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: …Take care of the mess if I happen to vomit on this carriage, Rain.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Big Sis, please!

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: Attention all passengers. Please fasten your seatbelts.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re departing now.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Oi, I’ve always wondered, what’s the point of these seatbelts?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Courtesy, I suppose. Who knows, it might actually be better than nothing.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: We will be initiating the warp in ten minutes.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Oh you. You’re clinging onto me like a baby.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Well you never know…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: We’ll be there just ten seconds after the train starts! But you’re cute, so I’ll let you be~

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Why’d we hafta sit right behind those two lousy lovebirds?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shh, shut it, they’ll hear us.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: Please do not open the doors while the train is in warp.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: I’ll be taking a nap. Wake me up when we’re there.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s going to take less than 10 minutes anyway.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Whatever~

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Big Sis! Big Sis! Wake up!

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Hell, what’s it this time?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Something seems to have gone wrong. It’s been an hour since we departed, but the train still hasn’t arrived at its stop.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: What’s happening, Merry…? You said we’d be there in just ten seconds.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: That’s strange… It shouldn’t take any longer than that…

Dialog.Title: NONE
Dialog.Content: - 6 hours in -

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Bollocks, did we get unlucky or what?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: WARP hasn’t had any accidents in the last ten years, though.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: We might end up getting trapped here.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: We’re breaking through that door if anything goes wrong.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re insane! The warnings said you’ll get sucked out into space if we try to open the doors while the train’s in warp.

Dialog.Title: NONE
Dialog.Content: - 17 hours in -

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’m gonna lose my mind…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Where are we?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I can’t even take off this seatbelt…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… Everything will be fine soon enough… I’m sorry, it’s my fault for asking to take a WARP train…

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: The train seems to be operating still…

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Oi! Take out your tools now. We’re cutting off this bloody seatbelt.

Dialog.Title: NONE
Dialog.Content: - 31 hours in -

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Bloody hell, this is driving me nuts! Three hundred poor souls are trapped in ‘ere, and they do fuck all about it?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: The atmosphere is getting eerie. Everyone seems more sensitive than usual.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: What’s funnier is that I’m not feeling any thirst or hunger even though we haven’t had anything in the last 31 hours.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: It won’t even leave a dent on this bloody door.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Guess we really are trapped. I don’t see a way out. All we can do is wait.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Looks like others are slowly losing their minds, too.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: …Oi, how ‘bout a gamble?

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: What do you mean, a gamble?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: I’m saying, maybe we use this.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: An invitation…?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: It’s the stuff I got from Myo. Never thought I’d use it now.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Here’s my pen. I’d do anything to get out of this train, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A malfunction with WARP? This could be a huge blow to W Corp’s reputation if it ever gets out to the public.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was supposed to arrive at the destination in only 10 seconds, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. The WARP trains, operating with W Corp’s Singularity. They can get to any station in 10 seconds no matter how far away they are. A 30-second delay would be a big enough issue already, and a 30-hour delay? That’s gonna be outright fatal to the corporation’s trust.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even a Singularity can malfunction, it seems.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess no technology is ever really flawless.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway, I might be able to have an unexpected reunion soon enough.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You have any familiar faces in that Office?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You mean Myo, the captain of the Rabbit Team, then?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh… So you had connections with one of the captains from R Corp?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That Olga person knowing her is surprising enough, but you have some impressive networking finesse, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Though we probably won’t be greeting each other with smiles when we do meet again.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What, you weren’t friends with her? Eh, you know what, I guess it makes more sense this way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What did you expect? Did you really think I would have any friends to casually chat with?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I was just wondering. R Corp. is different from Fixers on a fundamental level.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Their work might seem similar to what Fixers do, but they take on things of a much larger scale with a much more professional mentality.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I expect no less from one of the Wings.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you relaxed.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Whew~ Now this is teleportation!

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Much faster and better than W Corp’s idiotic Singularity.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are we really sure we can proceed so carelessly? You said you got that invitation from R Corp.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Mika, shut him up for a bit. I think I’m gonna vomit right ‘ere if I hear another peep outta him.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Rain is speaking the truth, though. Maybe we should have been more cautious.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Sure, sure~ No one is on my side.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: It’s all thanks to my quick judgement that we could escape from that buggered train.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Good to see you too, lassie~

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: I apologize. We’re in a bit of confusion right now. And she’s hungover as well…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I understand. I do have experience dealing with drunkards.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Ey, you know what the hell was going on back there?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All I know is that you are our guests invited to the Library, I’m afraid.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Huh. She’s a bit nicer than what Myo told me.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Do you know her?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Ye see, we were supposed to dig into the relationship between L Corp. and the Library; that’s what Myo asked us to do.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I see, so that’s how you know about me.

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: And y’know what’s funny, lads~? We’re talking to a machine, not a person.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: Let’s not anger her now. We’ll just take the books listed on the invitation and leave, okay?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Let’s be blunt, lassie. You know what relationships the Library has with L Corp, donchya?

Dialog.Title: Molar Operator
Dialog.Content: Myo says the fact you’re in the Library is indisputable evidence that this place is related to L Corp somehow or another.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m sure you can find the answer to that in the books you seek.

Dialog.Title: Molar Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re terribly sorry. We’ll be going in now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Any guesses on why R Corp. cares about this place?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: L Corp. was a major client of R Corp, and it disappeared into thin air, so it’s natural for them to want to look into it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A major client of R Corp, huh…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess that makes sense. L Corp. and its Nest weren’t really special in terms of military power. It must have been a very important client for R Corp. if they were asked to protect a whole Nest.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was a mutual relationship, too. L Corp. was supplying all the energy R Corp. needed, and W Corp. depended on L Corp’s energy supply as well.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Three Wings in collusion with each other, huh. So much for trickle-down economics.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There’s no use complaining to me. I was simply following my orders.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Employees gotta do whatever their boss tells ‘em to do, whether it’s the Wings or the Backstreets.
